title: Tony Odur
text:
Tony Odur (born 7 December 1984) is a Ugandan <a href="association%20football">footballer</a> who last played for Katwe United in <a href="Uganda">Uganda</a>. Odur has also made <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">appearances</a> for the <a href="Uganda%20national%20football%20team">Uganda national football team</a>. In March 2010 Odur scored a memorable hat trick against <a href="Burundi">Burundi</a> in CHAN qualifiers.
2014 CAF Champions League.
 In CAF Champions league 2014, KCCA FC vs El Merriekih Tony Odur went on a score sheet with one <a href="goal">goal</a> and another one from <a href="team">team</a> mate Herman Wasswa to secure an away win against the sudaneses based El Merriekih in the 1st leg, he also scored the only <a href="goal">goal</a> in the 2nd leg in which KCAA FC lost to El Merriekih at home, <a href="kampala">kampala</a>, aggregate 3–2 in favour of KCCA FC.In CAF champions league 2014 <a href="Nkana">Nkana</a> vs kcca fc, Odur scored agoal in the 26th in a game which end in 2–2 draw, and this made him the only player of kcca fc to <a href="Score%20%28sport%29">score</a> in three games in <a href="Confederation%20of%20African%20Football">CAF</a> Champions league 2014 <a href="tournament">tournament</a>.
2003 to present.
Odur broke onto the scene in 2003 as an exciting youngster at <a href="Express%20FC">Express FC</a>. Together with the small Mark Mwambo, who has since quit the game, in <a href="midfield">midfield</a>, they were the new kids on the block that came off the bench at the <a href="CECAFA">CECAFA</a> club <a href="Championships">Championships</a> that year to turn the <a href="game">game</a> round.
The two were the talking points at that time and very exciting and at the end of that <a href="Football%20season">season</a>, they helped Express win the Kakungulu Cup. But more sticking is the wonderful late <a href="equaliser%20%28sports%29">equalizer</a> Odur scored in the 2004 Kakungulu Cup <a href="final%20%28competition%29">final</a> against KCC.
However, Odur's problems have been <a href="discipline">discipline</a>. Faruuk Ssimbwa, formerly an administrator at Express between 2005 and 2007 told The Observer [Uganda newspaper] that Odur was as talented as he was insubordinate. “He was the kind of <a href="Football%20player">player</a> who would at times want to hold the team at ransom if he wasn’t given what he wanted.”
It was one of the reasons he ended up quitting the <a href="team">team</a> and joining Bunamwaya. He also had a <a href="professional">professional</a> trials stint in <a href="Denmark">Denmark</a> although he wasn't successful, and Tony had this to say “I need to get a shot at such an opportunity again and that’s why I’m working hard.”
In April 2014, Tony went to Vietinam to hally work on his <a href="dream">dream</a> of playing in others outside League.so he directed to Vietinams' based team, Sai Gon FC for trials April 2014. In 2014 Tony missed out a crucial match in Uganda Cup, semi finals against Sc victoria university at phillip omondi stadium, due to a knee injury but kccf won the game 2-1
